com.caseybrooks.androidbibletools.basic

Class Reference.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.caseybrooks.androidbibletools.basic.Reference.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    Reference

    public static class Reference.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class to iteratively create a Reference. A Builder allows a user to set individual properties one at a time and check the validity of the Reference at any point before creating the Reference. As properties are set, bit flags maintain the state of data, which is necessary to ultimately create a valid Reference. These flags are set or unset as necessary by the Builder, but may optionally be manually set as well.
    See Also:
    Reference

      • parseReference

        public Reference.Builder parseReference(java.lang.String reference)
        Parse a String reference into this Builder, using the current Bible to match Book names against.

        Parsing a reference will fully extract the book (either taken directly from the set Bible, or failing that, creating a SimpleBook), the chapter, and an arbitrary list of verses from that book. See ReferenceParser for the expected format of a Reference.

        Parameters:
        reference - A string input to be fully parsed into this Builder
        Returns:
        this Builder, for chaining
        See Also:
        ReferenceParser

      • setBible

        public Reference.Builder setBible(java.lang.String versionName,
                                  java.lang.String versionAbbr)
        Creates a new SimpleBible for this builder. Useful for handing raw user input. If versionAbbr is not given, an abbreviation will be created based on the first letters of each word in versionName.
        Parameters:
        versionName - the full name of the Bible
        versionAbbr - the abbreviation of Bible.
        Returns:
        this Builder, for chaining
        See Also:
        SimpleBible

      • setBook

        public Reference.Builder setBook(java.lang.String bookName)
        Creates a Book for this Builder based on the set Bible. Whether the bookName can be found within the Bible is up to the implementation. If the Bible is not set, it will be set to its default value before proceeding. If the Bible is set to default, or if no match is found within the set Bible, then a new SimpleBook will be created using the bookName.
        Parameters:
        bookName - the full name of the Book to search for in the set Bible
        Returns:
        this Builder, for chaining
        See Also:
        SimpleBible, SimpleBook

      • setBook

        public Reference.Builder setBook(java.lang.String bookName,
                                 java.lang.String bookAbbr,
                                 int location,
                                 int[] chapters)
        Creates a new SimpleBook with the given information, making no attempt to match it against the set Bible. If bookAbbr is not given, an abbreviation will be created from the first three characters of the bookName. If location is not given, it will be given the largest possible value, to ensure it always gets sorted to the end of a list, not interfering with the sorting of Books with a location. If chapters is not given, it will be set to an empty list.
        Parameters:
        bookName - the name of the Book
        bookAbbr - the abbreviation of the Book
        location - the relative position in the Bible where this Book is located
        chapters - the list of verse counts for each chapter in this Book
        Returns:
        this Builder, for chaining

      • addAllVersesInChapter

        public Reference.Builder addAllVersesInChapter()

        Returns:

      • create

        public Reference create()
        Creates a Reference from the current state of this Builder. Any null values will be set to their defaults, which will likely not yield a meaningful Reference, but will still be considered valid. IF the PREVENT_AUTO_ADD_VERSES_FLAG has been set, then the absence of set verses will not add any to the final Reference. If the PREVENT_AUTO_ADD_VERSES_FLAG is not set, but a chapter has been given, then all verses in that chapter will be added, otherwise, just the first verse will be added.
        Returns:
        a Reference containing the data of this Builder.
